text:
There is a contact properties API, I’ve not looked into it so may or may not do what you want but worth a look
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/contact-properties-overview>
(oh apparently this one is out of beta too <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs-beta/crm/properties>)

Sorry, my bad, it wouldn't be one call per property but one call to the contact api and one to contact property then manually find properties that have key-value pairs and map key to value using the result from the contact property API. Still doesn't seem very efficient
Does anyone know if you can pull the number of columns from the form builder on each fieldset via the Forms API?

I’m working with a client that is using Scribe Online to pass through contact data from Dynamics. They’re sending through about 87k contacts, but HubSpot has only loaded 74k of them. There are only a few hundred errors coming back from HubSpot. Is anyone aware of a way to see API calls for a portal so I can see how many contacts were actually attempted or if there were additional errors on the HubSpot side that Scribe is not logging?
I have seen this doen and one issue was that MSD allowed for duplicate records to have the same email and HubSpot does not.
That was one of my first thoughts. We found about 1700 duplicates so not enough to explain the difference. The client side developer is resubmitting records and they are going through.
need to make sure it’s reliable going forward though. Are you aware of any HubSpot-side logs that we can look at instead of relying on Scribe?

What is the proper channel to report issues with the v3 API? I got a strange response when interacting with the Contact endpoint the other day:

```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Exception while calling underlying service. This is not peano's fault.",
    "correlationId": "3152e457-e8ee-46e2-a10f-395e0f5f755a",
    "category": "VALIDATION_ERROR",
    "requestId": "03c2cb89-d899-49ac-a85a-b8bc4150469f"
}```

I'm working on a Workflow extension, and no matter what i do i keep getting the token drop down on each TEXT field (i tried
```"allowsMergeTags": false```
 i tried not including the "allowsMergeTags" at all, but i always get it. Any clue?
The workflow extension definition shows false but the tokens are offered anyway

`{`
`key: "name"`
`label: "Action Name (choose a new name to reset balanced distribution)"`
`values: [1]`
`0: {`
`allowsMergeTags: false`
`type: "STATIC_VALUE"`
`options: [0]`
`}`
*`-`*
*`-`*
`fieldType: "TEXT"`
`required: true`
`}`
}

Hi team, does anyone know how HubSpot handles special characters in the _X-HubSpot-Signature-Version?_
When a name (company, person, etc.) has special characters e.g. CafÃ© (yes that’s a name from someone’s CRM) it’s challenging to validate the signature.
It would be great to know how HubSpot handles this so I can use the same hashing algorithm to compare.
Looking like batch updates was causing the problem. if the batch of contacts contains even a single record that was rejected, then the entire batch is rejected as well
it’s in the batch api documentation
The forum at <http://integrate.HubSpot.com|integrate.HubSpot.com> if the pins are correct.
